In other instances, the height of some traditional shopfronts means projecting or hanging signs may need to be placed higher for safety reasons. Any lighting associated with advertisements, signage or hoardings should be discreet and well placed so that it does not interfere with the visual amenity of the historic environment. External lighting should generally be used within conservation areas rather than internal illumination, due to the potential impact on heritage assets; but proposals for such lighting will still need to be carefully considered in the design process to ensure they are sensitively incorporated into the area.
